description: Alterations and extension to roof to form end gable; rear dormer; two rooflights in front roofslope; single storey side to rear extension; external alterations (demolition of lean to)
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed single storey side to rear extension, by reason of its siting and extensive rearward projection beyond No. 36 Leighton Close would give rise to an undue loss of light and outlook to the rear garden and rear facing habitable room windows of this neighbouring property. The proposed development would thereby be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;"><span arial="">the</span></span><span style="line-height: normal;"><span arial="">&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 D(7) of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021),&nbsp;</span></span><span style="line-height: normal;"><span arial="" style="">Policy DM1 C, DM1 D&nbsp;(d), (e) and (f) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span><br></p>

<p><span style="line-height:normal">The proposed single storey side to rear extension, by reason of its prominent siting, excessive width, footprint, bulk, and uncharacteristic layout, would give rise to an unattractive and excessive scale of development on the site, which would subsume the original scale and character of the property,&nbsp;and would appear unduly at odds with&nbsp;the established pattern of development along the street scene and within the locality.</span><span style="line-height:normal">&nbsp;The proposed development would thereby be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the</span><span style="line-height:normal">&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 D(1) and (11) of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021),&nbsp;</span><span style="line-height:normal">Policy DM1 A, DM1 B (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span>&nbsp;<br></p>
